resources.string: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Sighisoara - Cavaler

Located 200 m from the Sighișoara Citadel, listed as a World Heritage Site by the UNESCO, DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Sighisoara - Cavaler offers free access to a spa featuring a Finnish sauna, a steam bath, and an indoor pool. \nAll the stylish, air-conditioned rooms provide a minibar and a flat-screen TV. The bathrooms come with all toiletries. Some of DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Sighisoara - Cavaler’s rooms and suites have interior stairs.

Situated within the UNESCO-protected Sighişoara Citadel, the Pension Casa Saseasca occupies a historic building dating back to the 18th century. Free WiFi is available.\nAll rooms feature hand-made traditional furniture and have a private bathroom.

Offering an on-site restaurant, Hotel Korona is situated at the foot of the Mediaeval Citadel of Sighisoara, a 5-minute walk from the commercial and historic centre. It offers spacious accommodation with free WiFi.

Casa Wagner welcomes you in an unique historic setting on the main square of the UNESCO-protected old town of Sighisoara and offers you well-equipped, individually decorated rooms and fine cuisine. \nFrom the moment you enter the hotel rooms or you see the vaulted ceiling of the restaurant or the wine cellar, you will be surrounded by a unique historic ambience.

Taschler Haus offers accommodation in Sighişoara, only 150 m away from the renown 14th-century Clock Tower. Free WiFi is available throughout the property.\nThe rooms are fitted with a flat-screen TV and a private bathroom. For your comfort, you will find free toiletries and a hairdryer. Some units feature a seating area to relax in after a busy day, and a safe is available in every unit.
Romanian and international cuisine served in a elegant setting. Best Romanian wine selection in Transylvania.

In the menu list are found many dishes, carefully chosen, for flavor, finesse and especially for all tastes. \nThe kitchen of our house is lead by Chef Florin Mihalache, who prepares well documented plates, whether it's about fine ingredients, or that we have a traditional recipe in front of us, EVERY DISH HAS IT'S OWN STORY.
"The restaurant has mainly traditional food from local cuisine (hungarian and romanian)"

The Clock Tower of Sighișoara is the main entry point to the citadel, opposite guarded by Taylor\'s Tower. With its 64 meters of height, the tower is visible from almost every corner of the city from Mures County, its purpose was to defend the main gate of the citadel and also served as the town hall until 1556. Now It's considered one of the most expressive clock tower in the whole Transylvania.

This is an old wood and stone staircase with a wooden roof along the whole span. It has 175 wood steps and is was build in 1642 with the aim to make easier access for school students to reach the Hill School.

The Church on the Hill is an architecturally significant church located in Sighişoara, Mureș County in Romania.This church is the most important monument of religious architecture in Sighisoara and is one of the great churches of Transylvania, being the third largest.

The Historic Centre of Sighișoara is the old historic center of the town of Sighișoara,Romania, built in the 12th century by Saxon colonists under the Latin name Castrum Sex. It is an inhabited medieval citadel that, in 1999, was designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site for its 850-year-old testament to the history and culture of the Transylvanian Saxons.
Sighişoara Medieval Festival or Festivalul Sighişoara Medievală is a Romanian festival held on the last weekend of July in Sighişoara, Romania.
